item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Barbara Michaels
item.description: "Bruce ate a mouthful of eggs and meditated. 'I wonder how many of the great heroes of history would turn out to be a slow runner, if you ever investigated the circumstances." -- Barbara Michaels

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "Celebrity is a mask that eats into the face." -- John Updike

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Philip Roth
item.description: "Everybody else is working to change, persuade, tempt and control them. The best readers come to fiction to be free of all that noise." -- Philip Roth

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Dodie Smith

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Jim Butcher

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment." -- Rumi

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by John Steinbeck

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of the hunger for life that gnaws in us all." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Anne Sexton

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Elizabeth Peters

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Alice Walker

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Elmore Leonard
item.description:
"Elmore Leonard's Ten Rules of Writing
1. Never open a book with weather. 2. Avoid prologues. 3. Never use a verb other than "said" to carry dialogue. 4. Never use an adverb to modify the verb "said”…he admonished gravely. 5. Keep your exclamation points under control. You are allowed no more than two or three per 100,000 words of prose. 6. Never use the words "suddenly" or "all hell broke loose." 7. Use regional dialect, patois, sparingly. 8. Avoid detailed descriptions of characters. 9. Don't go into great detail describing places and things. 10. Try to leave out the part that readers tend to skip.
My most important rule is one that sums up the 10.
If it sounds like writing, I rewrite it." -- Elmore Leonard

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Elmore Leonard
item.description: "Psychopaths... people who know the differences between right and wrong, but don't give a shit. That's what most of my characters are like." -- Elmore Leonard

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?" -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Louis L'Amour
item.description: "Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on." -- Louis L'Amour

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?" -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Sarah Rhea add a quote by Leonora Carrington
item.description: "We went down into the silent garden. Dawn is the time when nothing breathes, the hour of silence. Everything is transfixed, only the light moves." -- Leonora Carrington
